title: Relationship with Relatives
description: Navigating relationships with extended family—in-laws, cousins, aunts, and uncles—is a balancing act of love, duty, and boundaries. The key is to maintain respect while protecting your own family's peace.
sentences: You can love your relatives without liking all of their behavior.
Establish clear boundaries around visits, advice, and financial matters.
Present a united front with your partner when dealing with in-laws.
You don't have to attend every single family function.
Find common ground and focus on positive shared interests.
dos: Be polite and respectful, even when you disagree.
Remember birthdays and anniversaries with a simple message or call.
Offer help during family emergencies or important events.
Choose your battles wisely; not everything needs to be a confrontation.
donts: Don't get drawn into family drama or gossip.
Don't compare your family to your partner's family.
Don't overshare personal information that could be used against you.
Don't feel obligated to loan money if you're not comfortable.
